original: @200b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @200b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: gu na aa paryanta sto tra t'i k'a ;
analyzed: gu na aa paryanta sto tra t'i k'a ;
translated: GunÄparÄntastotrapadya

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: yon tan mtha' yas par bstod pa'i 'grel ba /
analyzed: yon tan mtha' yas par bstod pa'i 'grel ba /
translated: Commentary on the Praise of Infinite Qualities

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the noble MaÃ±juÅ›rÄ«.

original: rgyal ba'i yon tan mtha' mi 'tshal zhes bya ba gleng bslang ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni bsdus pa'i don bzhi po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i yon tan mtha' mi 'tshal zhes bya ba gleng bslang ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni bsdus pa'i don bzhi po 'di lta ste /
translated: This verse of introduction, The qualities of the Victor are not fully known, teaches four summarized meanings:

original: yon tan yongs su mi shes pa dang ; sgro 'dogs pa med par bya ba dang / nga rgyal med par bya ba dang / 'dod pa'i don bsgrub par bya ba rnams bstan to //
analyzed: yon tan yongs su mi shes pa dang ; sgro 'dogs pa med par bya ba dang / nga rgyal med par bya ba dang / 'dod pa'i don bsgrub par bya ba rnams bstan to //
translated: The non-exhaustion of qualities, the absence of superimposition, the absence of pride, and the accomplishment of the desired purpose.

original: de la dang pos ni yon tan yongs su mi shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: de la dang pos ni yon tan yongs su mi shes pa bstan to //
translated: Among them, the first teaches the non-exhaustion of qualities.

original: gang slad 'gro 'dis khyod la bstod pa bgyis kyang zhes bya ba 'dis ni sgro 'dogs pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang slad 'gro 'dis khyod la bstod pa bgyis kyang zhes bya ba 'dis ni sgro 'dogs pa med pa nyid do //
translated: Even though this world praises you teaches the absence of superimposition.

original: rab tu chung yang zhes bya ba 'dis ni nga rgyal med pa nyid do //
analyzed: rab tu chung yang zhes bya ba 'dis ni nga rgyal med pa nyid do //
translated: Even though very small teaches the absence of pride.

original: don 'dir bdag ni blo gros rab tu chung yang brtson pa lags //
analyzed: don 'dir bdag ni blo gros rab tu chung yang brtson pa lags //
translated: In this matter, I am of very little intelligence, but I am zealous.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'dod pa'i don bsgrub par bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'dod pa'i don bsgrub par bya ba bstan to //
translated: By this verse, he shows the accomplishment of the desired aim.ğŸ”½There, he begins the praise with fifty verses beginning with:

original: de la ngan song gnas na'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa lnga bcus bstod pa rtsom par byed do //
analyzed: de la ngan song gnas na'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa lnga bcus bstod pa rtsom par byed do //
translated: Even in the miserable states, you were not overcome by the misery.

original: de la bstod pa ni thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la bstod pa ni thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: There, praise is the expression of uncommon qualities.

original: de yang gnas skabs gsum po rgyu'i gnas skabs dang / 'bras bu'i gnas skabs dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i gnas skabs rnams dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang gnas skabs gsum po rgyu'i gnas skabs dang / 'bras bu'i gnas skabs dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i gnas skabs rnams dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: And that is endowed with three states: the causal state, the resultant state, and the state of working for the benefit of living beings.

original: de la rgyu'i gnas skabs ni sems bskyed pa la sogs pa nas byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug pa'i bar dag yin no //
analyzed: de la rgyu'i gnas skabs ni sems bskyed pa la sogs pa nas byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug pa'i bar dag yin no //
translated: There, the causal state is from the arousing of the Mind up to the seat of enlightenment.

original: 'bras bu'i gnas skabs ni yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i ye shes bskyed pa dang / skyon dang yon tan thams cad spangs shing brnyes pa'i gnas skabs yin no ;
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gnas skabs ni yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i ye shes bskyed pa dang / skyon dang yon tan thams cad spangs shing brnyes pa'i gnas skabs yin no ;
translated: The phase of result is the generation of the intuition of perfect enlightenment and the phase of the attainment of all virtues and the abandonment of all faults.

original: / sems can gyi don bya ba'i gnas skabs ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la sogs pa bstan pa nas nub pa la thug pa'i bar dag yin no //
analyzed: / sems can gyi don bya ba'i gnas skabs ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la sogs pa bstan pa nas nub pa la thug pa'i bar dag yin no //
translated: The phase of working for the benefit of sentient beings is the phase of teaching the wheel of the Dharma and so on until the disappearance of the teaching.

original: de la rgyu'i gnas skabs ni bsam pa'i gnas skabs dang / sbyor ba'i gnas skabs dang / dbang mdzad pa'i gnas skabs @201a * //
analyzed: de la rgyu'i gnas skabs ni bsam pa'i gnas skabs dang / sbyor ba'i gnas skabs dang / dbang mdzad pa'i gnas skabs @201a * //
translated: The phase of cause is the phase of aspiration, the phase of application, and the phase of mastery.

original: rnams so // bsam pa'i gnas skabs ni gzhan gyi don la 'jug par 'gyur ba'i smon lam gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnams so // bsam pa'i gnas skabs ni gzhan gyi don la 'jug par 'gyur ba'i smon lam gang yin pa'o //
translated: The phase of aspiration is the vow to engage in the benefit of others.

original: de'i nye bar bstan pa yang bzhi ste /
analyzed: de'i nye bar bstan pa yang bzhi ste /
translated: Its demonstration is fourfold.

original: sdug bsngal bskyed pa la so sor rtog pa dang / phan btags pa la so sor rtog pa dang / grogs byas pa la so sor rtog pa dang yang dag par longs spyad pa la so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bskyed pa la so sor rtog pa dang / phan btags pa la so sor rtog pa dang / grogs byas pa la so sor rtog pa dang yang dag par longs spyad pa la so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: the discernment of the production of suffering, the discernment of the bestowal of benefit, the discernment of the performance of service, and the discernment of the enjoyment of true enjoyment.

original: byang chub kyi smon lam de'i rgyu bzhi ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi smon lam de'i rgyu bzhi ste /
translated: The cause of the vow of enlightenment is fourfold:

original: rigs dang dge bshes snying rje dang // sdug bsngal rnams kyis mi ldog pa //
analyzed: rigs dang dge bshes snying rje dang // sdug bsngal rnams kyis mi ldog pa //
translated: the spiritual gene, the spiritual friend, compassion, and the non-retrogression from suffering.

original: rgyu bzhi rkyen ni 'di dag gis //
analyzed: rgyu bzhi rkyen ni 'di dag gis //
translated: By these four causes and conditions,

original: byang chub sems ni rab tu 'jug /ğŸ”½ces gsungs pa dag ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems ni rab tu 'jug / ces gsungs pa dag ste /
translated: the thought of enlightenment is well-produced.

original: de ltar na don bcus ni bsam pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na don bcus ni bsam pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, by these ten topics, the thought of enlightenment is taught.

original: de la ngan song gnas na'ang zhes bya ba 'dis ni gzhan gyi don la 'gyur ba'i smon lam bstan to //
analyzed: de la ngan song gnas na'ang zhes bya ba 'dis ni gzhan gyi don la 'gyur ba'i smon lam bstan to //
translated: Therein, the line, â€œeven in the abodes of the miserable statesâ€ teaches the vow of the benefit of others.

original: de'i nye bar rtog pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de'i nye bar rtog pa bzhi ste /
translated: Its four considerations are:

original: re zhig de la sdug bsngal rnams kyis smas pa'i sems can la zhes bya ba 'di dag ni sdug bsngal bskyed pa la so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: re zhig de la sdug bsngal rnams kyis smas pa'i sems can la zhes bya ba 'di dag ni sdug bsngal bskyed pa la so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: The line, â€œfirst of all, to the sentient beings who are afflicted by suffering,â€ teaches the discernment of the production of suffering.

original: ma rig ldongs pas zhes bya ba 'di dag ni phan btags pa la so sor rtog pa'o //ğŸ”½sngon chad 'khor bar zhes bya ba 'di dag ni grogs byas pa la so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig ldongs pas zhes bya ba 'di dag ni phan btags pa la so sor rtog pa'o // sngon chad 'khor bar zhes bya ba 'di dag ni grogs byas pa la so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: The lines beginning blinded by ignorance are the reflection on the benefit they have received.ğŸ”½The lines beginning In the past, in cyclic existence are the reflection on their assistance.

original: longs spyad 'des dgongs zhes bya ba 'di dag ni yang dag par longs spyad pa la so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyad 'des dgongs zhes bya ba 'di dag ni yang dag par longs spyad pa la so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: The lines beginning Now that I have the chance are the reflection on the proper use of the opportunity.

original: gang slad 'gro ba mya ngan ma 'das zhes bya ba 'di dag ni byang chub kyi smon lam yin no //
analyzed: gang slad 'gro ba mya ngan ma 'das zhes bya ba 'di dag ni byang chub kyi smon lam yin no //
translated: The lines beginning Why should beings not attain nirvana? are the aspiration for enlightenment.

original: de'i rgyu yang rnam pa bzhi ste //
analyzed: de'i rgyu yang rnam pa bzhi ste //
translated: The causes of compassion are fourfold.

original: de la re zhig smad pa'i gnas skabs dag tu zhes bya ba 'di dag ni rigs yod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la re zhig smad pa'i gnas skabs dag tu zhes bya ba 'di dag ni rigs yod pa nyid yin no //
translated: The lines beginning In the lower realms are the reflection on the existence of the potential.

original: gang slad gal te rang la rag las zhes bya ba 'di dag ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa'o //
analyzed: gang slad gal te rang la rag las zhes bya ba 'di dag ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa'o //
translated: The lines beginning If it depends on oneself are the reflection on reliance on spiritual friends.

original: nyon mongs chu bo rab 'khrug ces bya ba 'di dag ni snying rje yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs chu bo rab 'khrug ces bya ba 'di dag ni snying rje yin no //
translated: The lines beginning The flood of afflictions are the reflection on compassion.

original: 'jig rten 'di dag rang la'ang zhes bya ba 'di dag ni sdug bsngal gyis mi ldog pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di dag rang la'ang zhes bya ba 'di dag ni sdug bsngal gyis mi ldog pa yin te /
translated: These verses, from â€œThe world is not satisfied with enjoymentâ€ up to â€œOne should not be satisfied with the worldâ€™s satisfaction,â€ show that one should not be satisfied with the worldâ€™s satisfaction.

original: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa bcus don bcu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa bcus don bcu bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, in ten verses, ten topics have been explained.

original: bsam pa'i gnas skabs kyi le'u ste dang po'o /
analyzed: bsam pa'i gnas skabs kyi le'u ste dang po'o /
translated: This concludes the first chapter, on the stage of aspiration, in the Ornament of the MahÄyÄna SÅ«tras.

original: // / sbyor ba'i gnas skabs zhes bya ba yang pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa ji snyed pa yin no //
analyzed: // / sbyor ba'i gnas skabs zhes bya ba yang pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa ji snyed pa yin no //
translated: The stage of practice is also as extensive as the teaching of the perfections.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: And that is twofold:

original: mos pas spyod pa rnams kyi dang / sa thob pa rnams @201b kyi'o //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa rnams kyi dang / sa thob pa rnams @201b kyi'o //
translated: that of those who practice with aspiration and that of those who have attained the stages.

original: de la re zhig mos pas spyod pa rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bcu ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig mos pas spyod pa rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bcu ste /
translated: First, the perfections of those who practice with aspiration are ten:

original: 'di ltar sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / thabs dang / smon lam dang / stobs dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag gi //
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / thabs dang / smon lam dang / stobs dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag gi //
translated: generosity, morality, patience, effort, meditation, wisdom, skillful means, aspiration, power, and knowledge.

original: de la gang zhig skye bo dman dang phongs pa re ba'i bsam ldan mthong na yang //
analyzed: de la gang zhig skye bo dman dang phongs pa re ba'i bsam ldan mthong na yang //
translated: When he sees a poor or lowly person with hopes,ğŸ”½

original: zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
translated: In this verse, the perfection of generosity is taught by the line â€œWhen seeing lowly and destitute people with hopeful thoughts.â€

original: rigs par ldan pa'i tshig smra yang zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
analyzed: rigs par ldan pa'i tshig smra yang zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
translated: The perfection of morality is taught by the lines â€œSpeaking words that are reasonableâ€ and so on.

original: gang slad mkhas pa rnams kyi mi dge'i las kyang zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa'i sgo nas bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
analyzed: gang slad mkhas pa rnams kyi mi dge'i las kyang zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa'i sgo nas bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
translated: The perfection of patience is taught by the line â€œEven the unwholesome actions of the wiseâ€ in terms of abandoning counteragents.

original: bdag nyid zhi bar bgyi slad ces bya ba 'di dag gis ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
analyzed: bdag nyid zhi bar bgyi slad ces bya ba 'di dag gis ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
translated: The perfection of effort is taught by the line â€œIn order to pacify oneself.â€

original: sbyin par bzhed pa ma spangs zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa'i sgo nas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
analyzed: sbyin par bzhed pa ma spangs zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa'i sgo nas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
translated: The perfection of concentration is taught by the line â€œNot abandoning what is to be givenâ€ in terms of abandoning counteragents.

original: bdag bstod ma mdzad la zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
analyzed: bdag bstod ma mdzad la zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
translated: In these verses beginning with â€œnot praising himself,â€ the perfection of wisdom is taught through the abandonment of counteragents.

original: srid dang nyon mongs skyo bas zhes bya ba 'di dag dang / shes rab la sogs yon tan zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis kyis brgal ba dang / lan dang bcas par thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
analyzed: srid dang nyon mongs skyo bas zhes bya ba 'di dag dang / shes rab la sogs yon tan zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis kyis brgal ba dang / lan dang bcas par thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
translated: In these two verses beginning with â€œexistence, affliction, and weariness,â€ and â€œthe qualities of wisdom, etc.,â€ the perfection of skillful means is taught, together with objections and replies.

original: dus 'ga' 'ang byung ma gyur zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni phun sum tshogs pa rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
analyzed: dus 'ga' 'ang byung ma gyur zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni phun sum tshogs pa rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
translated: In these verses beginning with â€œnever having arisen,â€ the perfection of prayer is taught, which is the completion of perfection.

original: mtshan mo ston ka'i zla ba zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
analyzed: mtshan mo ston ka'i zla ba zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
translated: In these verses beginning with â€œthe autumn moon at night,â€ the perfection of power is taught.

original: 'jig rten sdug bsngal dag gis smras tshe zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten sdug bsngal dag gis smras tshe zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
translated: In these verses beginning with â€œwhen the world is afflicted with suffering,â€ the perfection of knowledge is taught.

original: mos pas spyod pa rnams kyi sbyor ba'i gnas skabs te le'u gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa rnams kyi sbyor ba'i gnas skabs te le'u gnyis pa'o /
translated: This is the second chapter, called â€œThe Stages of Practice.â€

original: // / sa thob pa rnams kyi sbyin pa ni phun sum tshogs pa rdzogs pa bzhi dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: // / sa thob pa rnams kyi sbyin pa ni phun sum tshogs pa rdzogs pa bzhi dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: The generosity of those who have attained the bodhisattva stages is endowed with four kinds of perfection:

original: bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / len pa po phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyin par bya ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //ğŸ”½phyug cing 'byor ba zhes @202a * //
analyzed: bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / len pa po phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyin par bya ba phun sum tshogs pa'o // phyug cing 'byor ba zhes @202a * //
translated: perfection of intention, perfection of application, perfection of recipient, and perfection of object given.

original: bya ba 'di dag gis ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa nyid do //ğŸ”½sbyin par spro ma mchis zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //ğŸ”½ri ngos ljon shing 'bras bu smin pa dag tu bya rnams lta bu zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni len pa po phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba 'di dag gis ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa nyid do // sbyin par spro ma mchis zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa'o // ri ngos ljon shing 'bras bu smin pa dag tu bya rnams lta bu zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni len pa po phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: These verses describe the perfection of intention.ğŸ”½These verses describe the perfection of application.ğŸ”½These verses describe the perfection of recipient.

original: dpal 'byor 'bangs dang btsun mo zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni sbyin par bya ba phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: dpal 'byor 'bangs dang btsun mo zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni sbyin par bya ba phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: These verses describe the perfection of object given.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of generosity.

original: 'jig rten 'di la gnod pa skye zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni rang bzhin yongs su dag pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di la gnod pa skye zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni rang bzhin yongs su dag pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: By these [verses] beginning with â€œharm to this world,â€ the perfection of morality is shown, which is pure by nature.

original: ji ltar sman pa gdon gyis zin la zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sman pa gdon gyis zin la zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: By these [verses] beginning with â€œjust as a doctor, seized by an evil spirit,â€ the perfection of patience is shown, which is free from conceptualization.

original: khyod kyis rtag tu yon tan nor lhag rnams la gus pas zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni thabs kyis rgyas pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis rtag tu yon tan nor lhag rnams la gus pas zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni thabs kyis rgyas pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: By these [verses] beginning with â€œyou should always respectfully honor the superior qualities and wealth,â€ the perfection of effort is shown, which is expanded by means.

original: ji ltar ma ma rang lus zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni skye bas stong ba'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
analyzed: ji ltar ma ma rang lus zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni skye bas stong ba'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
translated: By these [verses] beginning with â€œjust as a nurse with her own body,â€ the perfection of concentration is shown, which is empty of arising.

original: khyod kyi blo gros zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni thabs dang bcas pa'i brtson pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du thugs su chud pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: khyod kyi blo gros zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni thabs dang bcas pa'i brtson pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du thugs su chud pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: These two verses on the perfection of wisdom, which is the understanding of reality just as it is, together with the means, are the verses on the perfection of wisdom.

original: phrin las mnga' bar mi bzhed ces bya ba 'di dag dang gang slad shes rab don dam zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis kyis ni brgal ba dang lan dang bcas par thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: phrin las mnga' bar mi bzhed ces bya ba 'di dag dang gang slad shes rab don dam zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis kyis ni brgal ba dang lan dang bcas par thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: These two verses, beginning with â€œnot accepting mastery,â€ and the verse beginning with â€œthe wisdom of the ultimate,â€ are the verses on the perfection of means, together with the objections and replies.

original: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig gis sa thob pa rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bdun bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig gis sa thob pa rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bdun bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the eleven verses show the seven perfections of the bodhisattvas who have attained the stages.

original: sa thob pa rnams kyi sbyor ba'i gnas skabs te le'u gsum pa'o /
analyzed: sa thob pa rnams kyi sbyor ba'i gnas skabs te le'u gsum pa'o /
translated: This concludes the third chapter on the occasion of the application of those who have attained the stages.

original: // / de la mnga' dbang mdzad pa ni lnga ste /
analyzed: // / de la mnga' dbang mdzad pa ni lnga ste /
translated: The mastery is fivefold:

original: nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba dang / las dang / thabs dang / sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa dag go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba dang / las dang / thabs dang / sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa dag go //
translated: over addictions, over birth, over action, over means, and over complete ripening of living beings.
